    <h2 align="center">Ros√© Pine Cursor</h2>

<p align="center">All natural pine, faux fur and a bit of soho vibes for the classy minimalist</p>

<p align="center">
    <a href="https://github.com/rose-pine/rose-pine-theme">
        <img src="https://img.shields.io/badge/community-ros√©%20pine-26233a?labelColor=191724&logo=data:image/svg+xml;base64,&style=for-the-badge" />
    </a>
</p>

Based on <https://github.com/ful1e5/BreezeX_Cursor>

## Usage

### üêß Linux

1. Download here: <https://github.com/rose-pine/cursor/releases/download/v1.0.0/BreezeX-RosePine.tar.xz>
2. `tar -xvf ~/Downloads/BreezeX-Ros√©Pine.tar.xz -C ~/.local/share/icons`

3a. Choose the cursor theme with GNOME TWeaks, nwg-look, lxappearance, etc

3b. Or, install manually: <https://wiki.archlinux.org/title/Cursor_themes#Configuration>

### ü™ü Windows

1. Download here: <https://github.com/rose-pine/cursor/releases/download/v1.0.0/BreezeX-RosePine-Windows.zip>
2. <https://www.digitalcitizen.life/install-mouse-cursor-scheme-window/>

## Contributing

To build from source:

Requirements:
- Bun: <https://bun.sh>
- Clickgen: `pip install clickgen`

```sh
git clone https://github.com/rose-pine/cursor/
cd cursor
bunx ctgen build.toml -d 'bitmaps/BreezeX-Ros√©Pine' -n 'BreezeX-Ros√©Pine' -c 'Ros√© Pine BreezeX cursors.'
ctgen build.toml -d 'bitmaps/BreezeX-Ros√©Pine' -n 'BreezeX-Ros√©Pine' -c 'Ros√© Pine BreezeX cursors.'
```
